meta.title: Nimi Mehta: Career Journey and Finding Your Voice

purpose: To explore Nimi Mehta's career journey, starting from her first 'dream job' at MTV and the lessons learned after.
To discuss the transition from traditional media (radio) to entrepreneurship.
To understand the concepts of 'finding your voice' and The Voice Layer Theory.
To examine the challenge of balancing being 'nice' versus 'assertive'.

workstreams.name: MTV Presenter
workstreams.notes: First job out of university at 21. Contract ended after one year.

workstreams.name: Career Hustle / Internships
workstreams.notes: Period of unemployment. Used 'power of proximity' strategy at VIACOM (NICKELODEON). Pursued 'process of elimination' via internships (e.g., ITV).

workstreams.name: Radio (UK)
workstreams.notes: Pivoted to radio at a local station for 5 months due to lack of TV opportunities.

workstreams.name: CHANNEL4_DUBAI
workstreams.notes: Poached from RADIO1_AD; hosted the #1 breakfast show for 5 years.

workstreams.name: Entrepreneurship (Speaker)
workstreams.notes: Current role as CEO of Speaker and public speaking mentor, transitioning into 'legacy mode'.

workstreams.name: Framework Development (The Voice Layer Theory)
workstreams.notes: A framework created by Nimi Mehta to teach others how to find their voice.

decisions.decision: Nimi Mehta decided to pursue journalism at university.
Decided to use the 'power of proximity' to get a job within VIACOM (NICKELODEON) to stay in the building.
Decided to use a 'process of elimination' to learn every role (producer, director) in the media industry.
Decided to pivot to radio due to a lack of TV opportunities in the UK.
Decided to move to RADIO1_AD to host the breakfast show.
Decided to leave CHANNEL4_DUBAI after 5 years, choosing the fear of stagnation over the fear of leaving a stable salary.
Decided to 'isolate' her voice by taking a social media detox and questioning all her decisions and opinions.
Decided to evaluate the five closest people to her and 'cutthroat' remove those who were not a positive influence.

risks_open.risk: Career volatility: The 'dream job' at MTV ended after one year when the contract was not renewed, leading to a 'hit to the ego' and unemployment.
Evolving goals: Realization that goals are just 'markers' and dreams are 'ever evolving,' rather than a single endpoint.
Humans are 'never ever the finished product' and were not taught this lesson.
Fear of stagnation: The fear of 'feeling undervalued and miserable' in 5 years at a stable job (CHANNEL4_DUBAI) outweighed the fear of leaving comfort and salary.
Dilution of voice: External influences (parents, media, social media) build 'layers' that dilute a person's authentic voice.
risks_open.mitigation: Isolate the voice (detox, questioning) and evaluate the five closest people.

risks_open.risk: Environmental regression: Risk of regressing to an 'insecure, timid' version of oneself when surrounded by people who know the 'old me'.
Assertiveness vs. 'Nice': Struggled with the false binary of being 'nice' (and walked over) or 'mean'.
risks_open.mitigation: Realizing one can be 'kind, but still be very clear and concise'.

risks_open.risk: In media, women are easily labeled a 'Diva' or 'difficult' for being clear.
People pleasing is defined as saying 'yes' to someone else and 'no' to yourself.
Confidence Perception: The loudest person in the room is often not the most confident; 'soft confidence' is equally valid.
